bug.author: MarkTension
bug.summary: Importing ml-agents doesn't include its scripts within Unity
bug.description:
Hi all, I've been experimenting with ml-agents, tested the example environment, and was able to run and train the balancing project. However, when I try to build my own project from scratch, ml-agents doesn't seem to get imported correctly. When for instance,
create empty project drag the UnitySDK/Assets/ML-Agents folder into my project's Assets folder 3 make an Empty gameObject and try to put the ml-agents c# brain script in it as a component, unity doesn't find it:
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16321685/68850512-7391f480-06d4-11ea-8de7-bc0caf4e1d39.png></denchmark-link>
What's going wrong?
Unity version: 2019.2.9f1 OS + version: Mac OSMojave ML-Agents version: 0.11.0

comments.comment: I was following this tutorial, but I noticed that i can still just inherit from ml-agents classes. I guess the video was doing this in an archaic way. Closing this for now
